title: Basics - Values in Painting
additionalNotes:
Watch till 40 minutes. Draw the swatches of different value.

Tip: If you are dipping in the water touch the rim once or twice. to ensure the water is reduced. You can use a tissue paper as well.

title: Two Techniques - WOW and WOD
additionalNotes: Watch till minutes 49 minutes. This demonstrtaes the Wet on Wet and Wet on Dry Technique. This is important to practice to understand what different techinque tends to look like

title: Brush holding Techinques
additionalNotes: This video demonstrates holding a pen and drawing circles, leaves and complex strokes

title: Easiest Way to Paint TEN Flowers with Watercolor!
additionalNotes: The flowers that are taught are lavender, black eyed susan, rose, cherry blossom, tulip, anemone, poppy, zinnia, delphinium, and a sunflower!

title: Landscape Backgrounds
additionalNotes: First of three part videos. Starting with backgrounds for landscape. Wet on Wet techniques, with gradient and multi color gradient blending

additionalLinks.title: Basic Wet on Wet for Backgrounds

title: Layering - using a tree
additionalNotes: Layering to form tress and mountains. Creating depth using the shadows and midtones.

title: Landscapes - Layering and Blending
additionalNotes: Layering on the backgrounds to form tress and mountains. Creating depth using the shadows and midtones.

title: How to Paint Anything with Watercolor
additionalNotes: If you follow these five steps, you can paint anything with watercolor. From flowers to toucans, from elephants to desert landscapes, these watercolor basics will help you get from blank sheet of paper to a finished painting that you're proud of. Let's look at these big picture watercolor painting techniques that will get you painting anything you want!

title: Abstract Backgrounds using Wet on Wet
